snippet: New York City agreed to pay $18 million to settle a lawsuit over the wrongful arrests of hundreds of people during a 2004 convention.
abstract: Editorial contends New York City's agreement to pay nearly $18 million for misconduct of the police department during the Republican National Convention in 2004 amounts to an expensive legal lesson in basic civil liberties; urges Mayor Bill De Blasio to use the settlement as a reminder that mass arrest without probable cause to arrest each individual is illegal.
lead_paragraph: New York City agreed to pay $18 million to settle a lawsuit over the wrongful arrests of hundreds of people during a 2004 convention.

headline.main: The Convention and the Damage Done
